alert.note: Alert for Espanola Valley; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Santa Fe Metro Area; Upper Tularosa Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 14 at 12:40PM MST until December 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. The strongest winds will likely occur late morning to midday. * WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro Area, Espanola Valley, Santa Fe Metro Area, Lower Rio Grande Valley, and Upper Tularosa Valley. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs may be blown down. Expect strong cross winds on area roadways along Interstate 25.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Espanola Valley; Lower Rio Grande Valley; Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Santa Fe Metro Area; Upper Tularosa Valley
